description: A cienaCesOamLinkEventTrap notification is sent whenever a local or remote link event is detected
and recorded in the cienaCesOamEventLogTable.
To enable the device to send this trap, cienaCesOamLinkEventTrapState needs to be set to enabled.
The cienaCesOamLinkEventTrapState is enabled by default. Variable bindings include:
cienaGlobalSeverity, cienaGlobalMacAddress, cienaCesOamEventNotifChassisIndex,
cienaCesOamEventNotifShelfIndex, cienaCesOamEventNotifSlotIndex, cienaCesOamEventNotifPortNumber
cienaCesOamEventLogType, cienaCesOamEventLogLocation, and cienaCesOamEventNotifChannelNumber.

Summary.eval: ($v8==1) ? 'Local $v7 link event detected' : 'Remote $v7 link event detected'

tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD CIENA-CES-OAM-MIB::cienaCesOamLinkEventTrap CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalSeverity i 5 CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalMacAddress x 000eaa12ddff CIENA-CES-OAM-MIB::cienaCesOamEventNotifChassisIndex u 1 CIENA-CES-OAM-MIB::cienaCesOamEventNotifShelfIndex u 1 CIENA-CES-OAM-MIB::cienaCesOamEventNotifSlotIndex u 1 CIENA-CES-OAM-MIB::cienaCesOamEventNotifPortNumber u 9998 CIENA-CES-OAM-MIB::cienaCesOamEventLogType i 2 CIENA-CES-OAM-MIB::cienaCesOamEventLogLocation i 1 CIENA-CES-OAM-MIB::cienaCesOamEventNotifChannelNumber u 9998

$SNMPTRAPCMD CIENA-CES-OAM-MIB::cienaCesOamLinkEventTrap CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalSeverity i 3 CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalMacAddress x 000eaa12ddff CIENA-CES-OAM-MIB::cienaCesOamEventNotifChassisIndex u 1 CIENA-CES-OAM-MIB::cienaCesOamEventNotifShelfIndex u 1 CIENA-CES-OAM-MIB::cienaCesOamEventNotifSlotIndex u 1 CIENA-CES-OAM-MIB::cienaCesOamEventNotifPortNumber u 9999 CIENA-CES-OAM-MIB::cienaCesOamEventLogType i 5 CIENA-CES-OAM-MIB::cienaCesOamEventLogLocation i 2 CIENA-CES-OAM-MIB::cienaCesOamEventNotifChannelNumber u 9999

description: This object defines the severity of a trap and is a part of every trap defined in the system.
variables.name: CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalSeverity

description: This object indicates the chassis MAC address.
variables.name: CIENA-GLOBAL-MIB::cienaGlobalMacAddress

description: This object indicates the chassis index for the port used for trap definition.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-OAM-MIB::cienaCesOamEventNotifChassisIndex

description: This object indicates the shelf index for the port used for trap definition.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-OAM-MIB::cienaCesOamEventNotifShelfIndex

description: This object indicates the slot index for the port used for trap definition.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-OAM-MIB::cienaCesOamEventNotifSlotIndex

description: This object indicates the port number for the corresponding PGID
used for trap definition.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-OAM-MIB::cienaCesOamEventNotifPortNumber

description: The type of event that generated this entry in the event log.
When the OUI is the IEEE 802.3 OUI of 0x0180C2, the following
event types are defined:
erroredSymbolEvent(1),
erroredFramePeriodEvent (2),
erroredFrameEvent(3)
erroredFrameSecondsEvent(4),
linkFault(256),
dyingGaspEvent(257)
criticalLinkEvent(258)
The first four are considered threshold crossing events as
they are generated when a metric exceeds a given value within
a specified window. The other three are not threshold
crossing events.
When the OUI is not 0x0180C2, then some other organization has
defined the event space. If event subtyping is known to the
implementation, it may be reflected here. Otherwise, this
value should return noEvent (99).
variables.name: CIENA-CES-OAM-MIB::cienaCesOamEventLogType

description: Whether this event occurred locally, or was received from the
OAM peer via Ethernet OAM.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-OAM-MIB::cienaCesOamEventLogLocation

description: This object indicates the channel number for the corresponding PGID
used for trap definition. The value 0 is used if port of concern is
not channelized.
variables.name: CIENA-CES-OAM-MIB::cienaCesOamEventNotifChannelNumber
